newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha physical deal at $191 supports swaps rate.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha physical deal at $191 supports swaps rate.

text.p: A jump in crude futures values and a tight European physical scene helped push up naphtha front-month swap values by $1-$1.50 as physical deals were reported done in NWE and the Med several dollars above quotes of a day earlier.

A London-based trader said he had sold a Greek cargo to a Med end-user at $190 for August 5-10 loading, and that he had purchased an open spec cargo in the north at $191 for July 25/August 5, reportedly from a north American products trader.
Brokers said the deals were likely to lift published highs, which stood at $185 for the north, by as much as $4-$5 after Wednesday's $7 jump.

One physical broker said the deals had come against the backdrop of a tight physical scene in which traders were buying up volumes in the north, although end-users were running for cover at current values.
The prospect of large-scale arb flows from the Med to both Asia and the US Gulf during July and August was also seen keeping that market short.
By late afternoon, August swap values were placed by dealers in the $190.50-$191.00 range as September backwardation widened to around $3.00 and October was seen $1.50-$2 behind September.
